result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 10:22 AM.
Defendant Michael J. Harvey not in court.  Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim present and makes a statement to the Court.
State indicates the matter has been rescheduled to 11/23/22 at 9:30 AM.
Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 10:10 AM.
Defendant Michael Harvey appeared in court without counsel. Attorney Trenton Piltz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing today at 2:30 but parties believe that was scheduled in error.
Defendant indicates he is currently working on hiring an attorney.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/3/22 at 2:00 PM.
RTN: 10/25/22 at 9:30 AM.

It is hereby ordered, the request is: Denied.
